turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: You're naked.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: It's my house.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: That's repulsive.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: What's the big deal? We're friends. Haven't you ever seen your friends naked before?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Need a lift?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: No thank you.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: How are you today?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Give it up.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Oh right, last night. I guess I owe you an apology.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I'm not going to speak to you till you realize that you can't intimidate me.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I said I was sorry.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: It was fine.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I wish I could say the same for myself. I was up thinking about you all night.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I thought we agreed that we were going to be friends.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Yes, well unfortunately I can't just switch the "on" button to "off." The sad fact of the matter is that you've unintentionally rubbed off on me.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: And that's a bad thing?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I'm trying to better myself, but the one person who can help me is the same one pushing me away.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I'm sorry, but I'm not here to be your savior.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Well try this one on for size. I think I'm falling in love with you.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: You don't even know me.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Don't you believe in love at first sight?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Yes, but only when it's mutual. And this is far from mutual.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Ouch. Do you think we could spend some time together this morning?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I can't. I'm seeing a friend.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: That's none of your business.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: How about tonight?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I'm busy.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Doing what?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: That's also none of your business.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Tell me what to do, Annette. How can I win your heart. I'll do anything. I can't get you out of my mind.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: You truly want to do something to make me happy?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: And you promise to abide by it?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Without question.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Alright.  I want you to leave and go back to New York.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: If that's a problem, then I'll make arrangements to stay with some friends.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I'll leave this afternoon. Happy?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: It's not about being happy. You and I can't -

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: No, not at all.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Well, I was just calling to see how you're doing.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I'm... I'm alright.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: How was your date?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: It wasn't a date. He's just a friend.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Well, I was just calling to tell you I was thinking about you and I miss you. I'll let you go.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Wait, don't hang up.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Okay?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Reading.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: What are you reading?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Of Human Bondage.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Somerset Maugham.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Yeah, it's pretty relevant considering my situation.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: You're not gonna start that again.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Sure. Have a good night.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I will.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Alone again.  What are you up to today?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I'm doing some volunteer work.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Need any company?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: You? Volunteer? I don't think so.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I don't know? Maybe I'd like it. I'm trying to change here. You could be supportive.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Babe, you're looking at the next Mother Teresa.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: It's weird. I actually feel good about myself. Can we do this again next week?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Oh please.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: "I actually feel good about myself?"

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I do.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: You must take me for a real idiot.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I don't.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: You're going to tell me that you had a good time with the old lady.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I did. We played three games of backgammon and...

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: That's okay. It doesn't make you a bad person.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Yes it does.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: No, it doesn't. I'm happy you're being honest with me.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I can't win with you.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: It's not about winning. You know what your problem is? You take yourself way too seriously.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I do not.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Lighten up.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I am lighten. Can we drop this?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Oh dear, are you actually laughing?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: No?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Am I bothering you?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Not at all. Have a seat.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: My friend Monsieur Philipe is a friend of Florentino.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Who's Monsieur Philipe?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You don't know Monsieur Philipe?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Bonjour Monsieur Philipe.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You are very pretty. I would like to kiss you.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You know what? I don't take it back.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Why are you doing this?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Because I'm in love with you.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I thought you said we were going to be friends.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I can't handle it. I can't keep my feelings bottled up like you. Can you honestly tell me that you feel nothing for me? ... Tell me!

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I have feelings for you.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Then what's wrong? I love you Annette. It's not like you have a husband, unless your married to Jesus.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: That's not fair.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Why can't we be together?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: You really want to know?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: It's because I don't trust myself with you.  I took a vow and because of you I'm tempted to break it. Don't destroy that for me. Please.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I just came to say goodbye.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Back to the city. I may take off to Europe for the rest of the summer. I just can't handle it around here.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I think that's for the best.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Good for you.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Sebastian, please. I don't want us to end on bad terms.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Well, I'm afraid you don't have a choice in the matter. You make me sick. You're a hypocrite and I don't associate with hypocrites.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: How am I a hypocrite?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Oh please Annette. You spend all your time preaching about waiting for love. Well here it is. Right in front of you, but you're going to turn your back on it. I'm sorry that we're not at the age where we can get married. If we were, I'd propose, but that's not going to happen. So I guess we're just fucked. I'll move on, but you... you're going to have to live with yourself knowing you've turned your back on love. And that makes you a hypocrite.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Please don't go.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Get off me.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I'm fine. I have to get going to my friends' house.  Was it --

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: It was perfect.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Would you like a tour?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: This isn't working out for me anymore.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Yeah, me neither.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: It's not you, it's me. I'm completely fucked up.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: What are you saying?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Why aren't you understanding?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: I love you.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I know. I wish I felt the same. Unfortunately, I feel nothing. I think it was just the conquest. Sorry, I'm completely fucked up.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Why are you trying to hurt me?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I'm just being honest. I just wanted to see what you were like in bed.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: You don't know how to love.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You don't even know me. The fact of the matter is there is some one I love. She's smarter, prettier... you don't even compare to her. The only reason I am here is because she wants us to be exclusive.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: But you knew this was important to me.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: What, your virginity? Well that's over now.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: It's a beautiful home you have here Mrs. Rosemond.

turns.speaker: AUNT HELEN
turns.text: Thank you, Annette. Chance Hill has been with my family for over sixty years. Does your family do much riding?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: My mother and I used to ride a lot, before she got sick.

turns.speaker: AUNT HELEN
turns.text: I'm sorry about that.

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: My Grandpa, used to breed horses on his farm so I would come over and ride all the time.

turns.speaker: AUNT HELEN
turns.text: I'm familiar with a lot of breeders in the mid-west. What's his name?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: Ben Schwarz.

turns.speaker: AUNT HELEN
turns.text: Schwarz. Jewish?

turns.speaker: ANNETTE
turns.text: German.

turns.speaker: AUNT HELEN
turns.text: Doesn't ring a bell.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Unbelievable. Some fag, no offense -

turns.speaker: BLAINE
turns.text: - none taken -

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: - wrote a letter to this chick and saying shit about me.

turns.speaker: BLAINE
turns.text: Any ideas who it could be?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Blaine, if I knew who it was that person wouldn't be alive right now.

turns.speaker: BLAINE
turns.text: Where did you say she's from?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Kansas. Who the hell do I know in Kansas?

turns.speaker: BLAINE
turns.text: Greg McConnell.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: The football stud?

turns.speaker: BLAINE
turns.text: He's from Kansas City. I wouldn't be surprised if he was your rat.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: It would make sense. McConnell hates me. I fingered his girlfriend at the game last year.

turns.speaker: BLAINE
turns.text: I don't think that bothered him.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: BLAINE
turns.text: Let's just say Greg likes tackling tight ends on and off the field.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Are you shitting me?

turns.speaker: BLAINE
turns.text: I shit you not. McConnell used to sneak in my dorm room drunk every month. We'd go at it for a while, then as soon as he'd cum, he starts freaking out. You know -  "What are you doing, man? I'm not a fag. I'll kick your ass if you say anything."  It's like, for Christsakes Greg, you're gay, deal with it. The only reason why I let him continue with his charade is because he's got a mouth like a Hoover.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Too bad he's in Kansas this summer.

turns.speaker: BLAINE
turns.text: Not anymore. Football team started practice last week. He's already called me to hook up.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Really. You think you could arrange a little get together with him tonight on my behalf?

turns.speaker: BLAINE
turns.text: Hmmm. I do believe Bravo is showing Spartacus on television tonight.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Outstanding.

turns.speaker: BLAINE
turns.text: Don't think it's not going to cost you.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: No problem. Just make sure your front door is unlocked. Shall we say the "stroke of midnight" no pun intended?

turns.speaker: BLAINE
turns.text: I think he's telling the truth Valmont. Greg couldn't write a grocery list let alone a letter.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Alright, I believe you. Stop crying. Your secret's safe with me.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Oh, I suck. I suck.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Relax. It's okay. Take a deep breath.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Ronald is one of the few high school students attending Juliard. He's composing his first opera.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: It's based on the life of Doctor Martin Luther King.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Doctor King is my favorite.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Well, I guess it's getting late. Please thank Kathryn for the use of her Steinway.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: I'll see you tomorrow.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: What are the boys like?

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: Cecile, is that the best you can do?  You must forgive her, Kathryn. She's never been in a co-educational atmosphere before.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Where did you find those?

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: Margarita found them while cleaning your room.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Those are my letters!

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: Don't you raise your voice at me. Go to your room, now.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: I'm in the bath, mom.

turns.speaker: MRS. CALDWELL
turns.text: Well hurry up. I want to be at Mrs. Rosemond's before lunch.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I was thanking her. Vietnamese is such a beautiful language.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I'll call you later and we'll get together and plan your curriculum.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Thanks.  Nice meeting you.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: So, rumor has it that you went on a date with Court Reynolds. I hear he's very nice.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: He's alright.  He kept talking about this bulimic headcase he dumped over Fourth Of July.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Really? Bulimic headcase.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: What a loser she must be.  Anyhow, Court's invited me to the Hamptons for Labor Day Weekend.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: That's great.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: You think so? I don't know. I guess I'm just scared.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: What are you scared of?

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Ah duh. Boys. I've never even gone to first base with a guy. What do I do?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Haven't you ever practiced with one of your girlfriends?

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Eww. No. That's gross.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: It's not gross. How else do you think girls learn? Here turn around and face me.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Are you for real?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Do you want to learn or not?

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: I guess. It still sounds gross.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: See that wasn't so bad.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: It was nothing.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Let's try it again, only this time I'm going to stick my tongue in your mouth. When I do that I want you to massage my tongue with yours. That's what first base is.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Eyes closed.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: That was cool.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Maybe you should try it on your friend Ronald sometime.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: What are you saying?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Oh come on Cecile. He's crazy about you.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Is it that obvious?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: That's so romantic. Have you responded?

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Well do you like him?

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Cecile, we just made out in the middle of Central Park. You can trust me.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: I do like him. I can't stop thinking about him.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Listen to me. Your mother must never know. Never.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Did you hide the letters?

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Yes. They're in this antique doll house in my room.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I want you to make me copies of his letters and bring them to me.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Cecile if there's one thing I'm great at it's love letters. With my help, he'll be eating out of the palm of your hand. Perhaps we can arrange a little get together for the two of you at my house.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: You'd do that for me?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Of course I would. We're friends, right?

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Best friends.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: It's Kathryn.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Calm down. Tell me what's wrong.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Something awful happened last night.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: What do you mean?!

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: I... I don't think you want to know.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Cecile, you have to tell me.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: It involves your brother. He... took advantage of me.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Does your mother know?

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: If she knew, she'd kill me. It happened at your house last night.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Why didn't you do something?

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: So, let me get this straight. You came over to our house late last night and he forced intercourse on you.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Well... not exactly.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: He made you give him a blow job.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Well what then?

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: If that's what you call it.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Cecile, I think you're going to have a hard time crying rape if that's all he did.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: What do I do then?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Well did you like it?

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Well... I don't know - it was weird. At first it felt icky, then it felt kind of okay. Then, I started getting really hot and then I started shaking and then like, I don't t know... it felt like an explosion, but a good one.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Cecile, you had an orgasm.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: I did?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I'm so proud of you. You're becoming a woman.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: I am?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Now listen. Now that you're on your way, it would be stupid of you to stop. Think of Sebastian as a tutor. Let him instruct you.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: I don't love him. I love Ronald.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: So? Don't you want to make Ronald a happy pappy? Practice makes perfect, Cecile. My advice is to sleep with as many people as possible.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: But that would make me a slut.  Wouldn't it?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Cecile, everybody does it. It's just that nobody talks about it.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: It's like a secret society.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: That's one way of looking at it.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Cool.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: My father just took me on a trip to Australia.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: How are things down under? Blossoming I hope.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: What year are you in?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I'm what you would call a fifth year senior.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: But I thought high school is only four years.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: It is, unless you're a fuck up, like myself.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Excellent.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: You think he'll like it?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: He'll love it.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Just taking your photo.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: I look terrible.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Mmmm, you're right. Those clothes don't do you justice. Why don't you take them off.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I'm sorry that was out of line.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: I want to go home.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I was just kidding.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: I want to go home.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Okay, okay. I'll just call your mom and have her come pick you up.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: My mom? Don't call my mom.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Why not? ... Oh wow, she doesn't know you're here. In fact, you're grounded. Jesus, you could get in a shitload of trouble for this. I think I should call her anyway.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Please please please. I'll do anything. Just don't call my mom.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Cecile, all I want to do is give you a kiss.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: And then I can go home?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Of course. I'm not a monster.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Just a kiss, right?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I swear.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You promised to let me kiss you.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: But -

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I don't want to kiss you here. I want to kiss you there.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Want to join me?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Some other time, Cecile.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Am I suppose to be this sore?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: For the first time, yes. It'll pass.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: I like it better when I'm on top.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Cecile. This is what I like to call quiet time. This is time when we reflect on what we've done.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You think?

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Is it me?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: No, you were fine.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I'm taking a shower.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Need any company?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Want a blow job?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Good night Cecile.

turns.speaker: CECILE
turns.text: Prude.

turns.speaker: DR. GREENBAUM
turns.text: Jesus. We've been at this for six months.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: DR. GREENBAUM
turns.text: And you haven't made an ounce of progress.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: DR. GREENBAUM
turns.text: But you said you have the worst reputation.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I do.

turns.speaker: DR. GREENBAUM
turns.text: Don't you want to change that?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Let me tell you something, doctor. Chicks love a guy with a bad rap. They say they don't, but they don't mean it. They all think that they're the ones that are going to "save me." The trick is to let them think it's true.

turns.speaker: DR. GREENBAUM
turns.text: I think that's all the time we have for today.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Same time next week?

turns.speaker: DR. GREENBAUM
turns.text: No. This is going to be our last session.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Why? I like spending time with you. You know, you're quite attractive for a woman your age. You have killer legs. Killer.

turns.speaker: DR. GREENBAUM
turns.text: This isn't a joke. Your parents spend a lot of money to send you here. I'm trying to help you.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Don't be insecure, Doc. You're a big help.

turns.speaker: DR. GREENBAUM
turns.text: You think you can come in here with that cute little smirk on your face and try and flirt with me. It doesn't work, Sebastian.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: It works a little.

turns.speaker: DR. GREENBAUM
turns.text: No it doesn't. I see right through you.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: DR. GREENBAUM
turns.text: I hope for your sake you grow out of this immature phase. It's going to get you into trouble.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Well, you don't have to get nasty about it.

turns.speaker: DR. GREENBAUM
turns.text: My daughter, Rachel.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Yummy.

turns.speaker: DR. GREENBAUM
turns.text: Don't even think about it. Rachel is an exceptionally well rounded young woman, who happens to be attending Princeton this fall. She's way too smart to fall for your line of b.s.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Really? Care to make a wager on that?

turns.speaker: DR. GREENBAUM
turns.text: Good luck, Sebastian.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: What, nervous I'm going to win?

turns.speaker: DR. GREENBAUM
turns.text: Would you please leave.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Hi, mom.

turns.speaker: DR. GREENBAUM
turns.text: Honey, is something wrong?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: He told me he loved me and I believed him.

turns.speaker: DR. GREENBAUM
turns.text: Who told you?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You don't know him. I'm so stupid.

turns.speaker: DR. GREENBAUM
turns.text: Alright honey, just calm down, take a deep breath, and step out of the circle.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Would you cut the psycho babble bullshit, mom. There's pictures of me on the internet.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Nudie pictures, what do you think?

turns.speaker: DR. GREENBAUM
turns.text: Jesus Christ, how can you be so stupid?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I don't know. He was just so charming. All he did was talk about how I had killer legs and how we wanted to photograph them. Things just got out of hand from there.  Mom? Are you there? Mom?  Mother!!!!

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Oh baby... oh baby...

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Baby?  Right on time.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Hey Blaine, did I leave my... holy shit.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Jesus!

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Greg, is that you under the covers?

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Get out of here.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Whoa!

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: I told you to lock the door.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: -- really drunk and blah blah blah blah blah.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Please don't tell anyone. This could ruin my career.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Your career? What about your family? Can you imagine the humiliation your father's going to feel when he finds out his pride and joy is a fudge- packer.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Annette Harrison? I don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Come on Greg. You're the only one who knows her. The truth will save you.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: I swear on my life, I never said a word to her about you.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Positive.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Did you do everything I asked you to?

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You told her I never said I love you before?

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You told her that people are jealous cause I'm loaded?

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: And you think she bought it?

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: I'm pretty sure she did.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Pretty sure or sure sure?

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: She bought it.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I'll be in touch.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Is she with you?

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Who is this?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Sebastian, you faggot. Is she with you?

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Where is she?!

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: I don't know. Why don't you leave her alone.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: McConnell, I'm gonna out your ass in two seconds if you don't tell me where she is.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: I told you I don't know.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: One.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Alright. She's staying with some friends of her parents. The O'Sheas. She caught the train twenty minutes ago into Grand Central.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Grand Central. You better not be fucking with me cause it's your ass on the line.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Pleased to meet you.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Likewise I'm sure.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: What do you do? Tell her you love her.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: But I can't even see her. She doesn't have her own phone, I don't even know her e-mail address.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Ronald?

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: It's Kathryn.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Hi Kathryn. Is everything okay?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: It's Sebastian. He's out of his mind.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I think he's high on drugs. He hit me, then took off. I'm afraid to be alone. Please come over.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: I'll be right there.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: And when I confronted him about his affair with Cecile he told me it was none of my business. Then when I said "Well what about Ronald," he said you were nothing more than a stupid... the n word and that you deserved what you got...

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: And this happened before you and I hooked up?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: It's been going on for a while.  Then he called me a disgrace to our family and that's when he hit me.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Racist piece of shit.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I'd be careful if I were you. God knows what he's up to.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: He doesn't scare me. I'll kick his ass in.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Will you stay here for the night? You can leave in the morning. That's when my parents get back and --

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Don't worry about it. I'll stay.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Cecile's attending Oakwood in the fall.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Outstanding.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Do you care to tell me what Mrs. White-trash and her stupid daughter are doing in my house?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I'm just taking the poor girl under my wing.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Lovely. How is your gold digging whore of a mother enjoying Bali? Zipping through my inheritance per usual?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Hopefully, though she suspects that your decrepit alcoholic father is diddling the maid.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Oh, poor baby. Well you can relax. I have a mission for you.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: In any event, my feelings were hurt when I learned that he had fallen for someone else. Someone chaste... pure... innocent.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: You don't mean?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I don't find this very funny,

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: So that's what this is all about.  We'll get together and plan your curriculum.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Keep your friends close and your enemies closer. When I get through with her, she'll be the premier Blow Job Queen of the Tri-State area and poor little Court's heart will be shattered.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Why go through Cecile? Why not just attack Court?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Because if there's an attack made on Court it could be traced back to me. I can't allow that to happen. Everybody loves me and I intend to keep it that way.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: I see your point... though why should I care?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I need you to seduce our young Cecile. Introduce her to your world of decadence and debauchery.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Sounds intriguing.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: She's quite cute you know. Young supple breasts, a tight firm ass and an uncharted pootie.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Oh come on, Kathryn. It's too easy. "But I thought high school was only four years." I mean, please. She knows nothing. She's seen nothing. I could have her under the table at Au Bar sucking me off before the appetizer arrived. Go get one of those moron friends of yours to do it. I have a reputation to uphold.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Oh but diddling the therapist's daughter is a challenge?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: That was just simple revenge. What I have planned requires sheer genius.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I'm not interested in the latest dating tips from Jonathan Taylor Thomas.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Shut up and turn to page 64.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Jesus Christ, is she for real?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Oh yes. I've read it over and over again. This baby's the real deal. Daddy's little angel. A paradigm of chastity and virtue.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: B.F.D. What do you plan to do? Fly to Kansas and woo little Dorothy.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: It just so happens we're not in Kansas anymore. Our little angel's father has accepted the new headmaster position at Oakwood. She's staying with my aunt up in Connecticut while Daddy sells his house. Can you imagine what this would do for my reputation? Screwing the new headmaster's virginal daughter before school starts? It will be my greatest victory.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: You don't stand a chance. Even this is out of your league.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Care to make a wager on that?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I'll think about it...

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Oh well, duty calls. Time to add another chapter to my work of art.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Oh gee, your journal. Could you be more queer?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: Could you be more desperate to read it?

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: What are the terms?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: If you lose, then that hot little Porsche of yours is mine.

turns.speaker: SEBASTIAN
turns.text: And if I win?
